name: CDC_CVX
title: CDC Vaccine Administered Codes (CVX)
publisher: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
description: CVX - Codes for vaccines administered (U.S. CDC).

concept.definition: adenovirus vaccine, type 4, live, oral
adenovirus vaccine, type 7, live, oral
adenovirus vaccine, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a adenovirus vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.definition: Anthrax vaccine, adsorbed, pre-exposure and post-exposure prophylaxis
Bacillus Calmette-Guerin vaccine
botulinum antitoxin
cholera vaccine, unspecified formulation
cytomegalovirus immune globulin, intravenous
dengue fever vaccine, tetravalent
diphtheria antitoxin
diphtheria and tetanus toxoids, adsorbed for pediatric use

property.valueString: Retired effective 04/30/2023.  All vaccine NDCs retired.  No further vaccines expected for this formulation.

concept.definition: diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, 5 pertussis antigens
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a DTaP vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.definition: DTaP-hepatitis B and poliovirus vaccine
DTaP-Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated (DTaP-Hib-IPV)
Diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine, and poliovirus vaccine, inactivated
diphtheria, tetanus toxoids and pertussis vaccine
DTP-Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine
DTP- Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate and hepatitis b vaccine

property.valueString: This CVX has been corrected. This non-US vaccine contained DTP, Hib and Hep B. It was withdrawn in 2007 .

concept.definition: hantavirus vaccine
hepatitis A vaccine, adult dosage
hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 2 dose schedule
hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, 3 dose schedule

property.valueString: This vaccine formulation is inactive and should not be used, except to record historic vaccinations with this formulation.

concept.definition: hepatitis A vaccine, pediatric dosage, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: Do NOT use this code.  If formulation is unknown, use CVX 85.  There is only one formulation of Hep A, peds.

concept.definition: hepatitis A vaccine, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepA vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

concept.definition: hepatitis A and hepatitis B vaccine
hepatitis B immune globulin
hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric or pediatric/adolescent dosage

property.valueString: This code applies to any standard pediatric formulation of Hepatitis B vaccine. It should not be used for the 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds). Use code 43 for that vaccine.

concept.definition: hepatitis B vaccine, adolescent/high risk infant dosage

property.valueString: As of August 27, 1998, Merck ceased distribution of their adolescent/high risk infant hepatitis B vaccine dosage. Code 42 should only be used to record historical records. For current administration of hepatitis B vaccine, pediatric/adolescent dosage, use code 08.

concept.definition: hepatitis B vaccine, adult dosage

property.valueString: This code applies to any standard adult dose and schedule. Also use CVX 43 for the FDA approved Recombivax HB 2-dose hepatitis B schedule for adolescents (11-15 year olds) using the adult formulation.

concept.display: Hep B, high-dosage, dialysis or IC
concept.definition: Hepatitis B vaccine (Hep B), high-dosage, dialysis or immunocompromised patient

property.valueString: This code is used record patient high dosage vaccine administration for dialysis or immunocompromised patients. For NDCs that are used for both regular vaccine and dialysis/IC high-dosage schedules (e.g. Engerix-B), are mapped to both CVX 43 and CVX 44. CVX code 44 should be utilized to record dialysis/IC dosing.

concept.definition: hepatitis B vaccine, unspecified formulation

property.valueString: This CVX code allows reporting of a vaccination when formulation is unknown (for example, when recording a HepB vaccination when noted on a vaccination card)

hepatitis E vaccine
herpes simplex virus, type 2 vaccine

property.valueString: This vaccine may still be in use until the existing lots expire on 8/19/16.

property.valueString: This CVX is intended for use when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing serogroups A, C, W and Y (conjugate or polysaccaride) was given and the exact formulation was not recorded. It should not be used to record newly administered immunizations. It is not to be used when one of the meningococcal vaccines containing other serogroups was administered.

property.valueString: This is the YF vaccine that has been available in the US for years. It is stabilized with sorbitol and gelatin.

concept.definition: zoster vaccine, live

property.valueString: Zostavax vaccine associated to this CVX Code retired 10/2022

concept.definition: no vaccine administered

property.valueString: Code 998 was added for use in VXU HL7 messages where the OBX segment is nested with the RXA segment, but the message does not contain information about a vaccine administration. An example of this use is to report the vaccines due next for a patient when no vaccine administration is being reported.

concept.definition: unknown vaccine or immune globulin

property.valueString: This CVX code has little utility and should rarely be used.

concept.definition: RESERVED - do not use

property.valueString: Code 99 will not be used in this table to avoid confusion with code 999.

concept.definition: Meningococcal, MCV4, unspecified conjugate formulation(groups A, C, Y and W-135)

property.valueString: This CVX should only be used for historical doses of meningococcal conjugate vaccine where the formulation is unknown (oligosaccharide vs polysaccharide). It is not the same as CVX 108, Meningococcal, unspecified formulation. This CVX is for unspecified Meningococcal conjugate vaccines.

concept.display: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, PF, 100 mcg/0.5mL dose or 50 mcg/0.25mL dose
concept.definition: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, preservative free, 100 mcg/0.5mL dose or 50 mcg/0.25mL dose

property.valueString: Original monovalent Moderna adult vaccine. FDA rescinded all doses for US use 4/18/2023. Continue to used to record historic US Moderna vaccines and those administered in non-US locations (includes tradename Spikevax)

concept.display: COVID-19, mRNA, LNP-S, PF, 30 mcg/0.3 mL dose
concept.definition: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, mRNA, spike protein, LNP, preservative free, 30 mcg/0.3mL dose

property.valueString: Original monovalent Pfizer adult vaccine (12+ yrs). FDA rescinded all doses for US use 4/18/2023.  Continue to use to record historic US Pfizer vaccines and Non-US vaccines administered (includes tradename Comirnaty)

concept.definition: SARS-COV-2 (COVID-19) vaccine, UNSPECIFIED

property.valueString: Unspecified code for COVID-19 not to be used to record patient US administration. May be used to record historic US administration if product not known.  CVX code 500 should be used to record Non-US vaccine where product is not known.

concept.display: COVID-19 vaccine, vector-nr, rS-ChAdOx1, PF, 0.5 mL

concept.display: COVID-19 vaccine, vector-nr, rS-Ad26, PF, 0.5 mL
